bioghist.p: David C. Cook Publishing Company was founded in 1875, when David C. Cook began printing tracts for use in his Sunday school classes in Chicago. Publishers of "Sunday School requisites, Lesson Helps, Papers, Etc.," Cook was not a Presbyterian publishing company, but its materials were used by Presbyterian missionaries to teach Native Americans.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of religious lesson cards with text and accompanying images of signs. Lesson titles include "God His Law of Love," "Jesus His Talk to His Disciples," and "Jesus Teaches To Pray, and the Beatitudes." The collection also includes several bound copies of "Jesus Sorrowing, Lived and Died to Save You; He Lives Again Forever" and envelopes for various lessons, stamped with images and words.
